Here is the order and sequence of the lines that define the loop's boundary: 1. `line_1`: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. `line_2`: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.2982] 3. `line_3`: Start Point = [0.75, 0.2982], End Point = [0.0, 0.2982] 4. `line_4`: Start Point = [0.0, 0.2982], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Remember that since this is the first part, there are no preceding cad models; thus, the boolean operation can be described as simply creating a new solid body. Extrude the Sketch After creating the sketch, the next step is to extrude the sketch into a 3D model. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Extrude the sketch 0.2501 units in the positive Z-direction (towards the normal) and 0 units in the negative Z-direction (opposite normal). The resulting shape will be a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top having the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.2501 - Height: 0.75 The first part of the CAD assembly is now complete. Move to the next part by following the provided JSON data and the given instructions. **Note**: With each new part, the same process is repeated. The instructions below follow the structure of the given JSON and the expectations already explained. Part 2: A Straight Rectangular Prism Construct a straight rectangular prism. Sketch for Face 1 Begin by creating a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system for part 2. Face 1 consists of a single loop (loop_1) with four connecting lines (line_1 through line_4). Here is the order and sequence of the lines that define the loop's boundary: 1. `line_1`: Start Point = [0.0, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.0] 2. `line_2`: Start Point = [0.75, 0.0], End Point = [0.75, 0.25] 3. `line_3`: Start Point = [0.75, 0.25], End Point = [0.0, 0.25] 4. `line_4`: Start Point = [0.0, 0.25], End Point = [0.0, 0.0] Describe the boolean operation as adding material to the existing CAD assembly. Extrude the Sketch Extrude the 2D sketch of Face 1 vertically (along the Z-axis) to create a 3D model with the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 - Width: 0.25 - Height: 0.5 Given that the part is being added to the existing CAD assembly, such an operation is best described as a "join," where new material is being added to the assembly.</description>
